error.signature: remote: error: File X is 100.00 MB; this exceeds GitHub's file size limit of 100.00 MB
error.regex: exceeds GitHub.*file size limit|this exceeds.*100.*MB|large files detected

verdict.summary: File exceeds GitHub's 100MB limit. Can't push even after removing — it's in git history.

dead_ends.action: Just delete the large file and push again
dead_ends.why_fails: File is still in git history — push will still fail
GitHub's limit is fixed at 100MB — can't be changed

workarounds.action: Use git filter-branch or BFG Repo Cleaner to remove from history
workarounds.how:
git filter-branch --tree-filter 'rm -f large-file.bin' HEAD
# or: bfg --strip-blobs-bigger-than 100M

workarounds.action: Use Git LFS for large files going forward: git lfs track '*.bin'
workarounds.how:
git lfs install
git lfs track '*.bin'
git add .gitattributes

workarounds.action: Add large files to .gitignore before committing

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'remote' indicates a file exceeding GitHub's size limit, while 'error' indicates a conflict when applying a Git stash.
'remote' indicates a file exceeding GitHub's size limit, while 'Already on 'main'' indicates already on the requested branch.
